comment: A proper class (representing a null graph, see ~ vtxvalprc ) has the property of a complete graph (see also ~ cplgr0v ), but cannot be an element of ` ComplGraph ` , of course. Because of this, a sethood antecedent like ` G e. W ` is necessary in the following theorems like ~ iscplgr . (Contributed by AV, 14-Feb-2022.)
